title: Grilled Tilapia

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are great choices for Tilapia. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 99 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris

instructions: Put the fish in a glass baking dish and season the fish on both sides with the Old Bay Seasoning.Pour a half cup of Italian dressing over the fish and refrigerate for 30 minutes.Heat your grill and put all 6 fish fillet on and let it cook on both sides until done.

steps.step: Put the fish in a glass baking dish and season the fish on both sides with the Old Bay Seasoning.
Pour a half cup of Italian dressing over the fish and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Heat your grill and put all 6 fish fillet on and let it cook on both sides until done.
